text: For those who develop in WordPress as well (sorry HS folks) they released their update 4.9.6 that includes GDPR stuff. Looks pretty nice and the exporting/deleting of data seems pretty nice. Something I think HS should try to mimic. It basically lets you choose either export or remove of data, you enter an email address and it will send it all over to the person via email.
only downside, there is no native form for the user to request it themselves. All has to be done in the backend via an admin (unless you use a plugin that was just released to make a form for it)

HS actually is working on implementing these things atleast on the back-end.
<https://www.HubSpot.com/data-privacy/gdpr/product-readiness>
The dates on there are outdated though so itâ€™d be good to get a current update on this stuff.
As of this morning, I believe the GDPR functionality is available in all portals.
